result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roberta F Burns

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed:  State's Motion in Limine.
Received and Filed:  State's Requested Jury Instructions.

Defendant Roberta F Burns appeared by video.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III appeared by video for Roberta F Burns.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Court set final pretrial and jury trial dates upon request from the defense.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery.  Court ordered all substantive motions to be filed by 11-04-2022 and all responses to be filed by 12-03-2022 or they will be deemed waived.  Scheduling order signed and filed.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Roberta F Burns. Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelton, Br. 40.

Defendant Roberta F Burns in court with Attorney Robert J Hampton.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer L. Marowsky. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BMB (except in his official capacity)

Defendant Roberta F Burns in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Roberta F Burns in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Roberta F Burns appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Roberta F Burns not in court.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/16/22 @ 1p
